passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • Polo is a team sport played on horseback. • The modern version of polo originated in Manipur, India. • Polo is one of the oldest known team sports. • The sport was introduced to the Western world by British military officers in the 19th century.
question: Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to describe the origin and spread of polo?

choices.A: Polo is a team sport played on horseback, and it is one of the oldest known team sports.
choices.B: The modern version of polo originated in Manipur, India, and is played on horseback.
choices.C: British military officers brought polo, a sport played on horseback, to the Western world in the 19th century.
choices.D: Originating in Manipur, India, polo is an ancient team sport that was introduced to the Western world by British military officers.

explanation: D: 'Originating in Manipur, India, polo is an ancient team sport that was introduced to the Western world by British military officers.' is the correct answer because it effectively uses relevant information from the notes to describe the origin of the sport and how it spread to the Western world.
distractor_explanation: 'Polo is a team sport played on horseback, and it is one of the oldest known team sports.' is incorrect because it does not mention the origin of the sport or how it spread to the Western world.
'The modern version of polo originated in Manipur, India, and is played on horseback.' is incorrect because it does not mention how the sport was introduced to the Western world.
'British military officers brought polo, a sport played on horseback, to the Western world in the 19th century.' is incorrect because it does not mention the origin of the sport in Manipur, India.
